intro: Pseudostellaria baekdusanensis, commonly known as the Baekdusan starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula, particularly found in the mountainous regions of North Korea. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its small, white or pinkish flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
